Class BinaryOp

  • java.lang.Object
    • CalculatorFunctions
      • BinaryOp

  • public class BinaryOp
extends CalculatorFunctions
    This class represents a set of two operands with an operator in between.
    Author:
    Nikhil Jindal

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  BinaryOp.Op
      Class that represents the four different operators (+, -, *, /)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CalculatorFunctions derivative()
      Overrides the derivative() method from CalculatorFunctions Utilizes the Product Rule and the Quotient Rule to determine the derivative of a BinaryOp
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Overrides the equals() method from Object Checks to see whether two BinaryOp's have the left and right operator and operand
      CalculatorFunctions getLeftOperand()
      Returns the operand to the left of the operator
      BinaryOp.Op getOperator()
      Returns the operator between the two operands
      CalculatorFunctions getRightOperand()
      Returns the operand to the right of the operator
      java.lang.String toString()
      Override the toString() method of Object Returns a String representation of the BinaryOp left operand will be placed inside parentheses if it is an instance of BinaryOp right operand will be placed inside parentheses if it is an instance of BinaryOp and has a different operator
      double value()
      Overrides the value() method from CalculatorFunctions Returns the calculated value of the BinaryOp if it has no variables
      double value(double d)
      Overrides the value(double d) method from CalculatorFunctions Returns the calculated value of the BinaryOp when the parameter is substituted in for any variables

        operator - the operator that should be in between the two opeands
